resources.string:
App developed by Ferdinando Traversa for Wiki Loves Monuments.
Tree icon derived by symbolon, CC-BY 3.0 license.
Navigation bar icons derived by FontAwesome, CC-BY-SA 4.0 license
English translation by Marco Montanari (@sirmmo)
Something went wrong! Make sure you have geolocation enabled and restart the app or click refresh.
Enable geolocation to use the map.
Unable to locate you, you have not given permission to locate. Search for a city by clicking on the magnifying glass or enable localization from your privacy settings.

Do you want to share some usage (in particular, the app version when you start the app) and crash data with the developer of this application with some anonymous information about your device, so that you can contribute to the app improvement? The data will not be shared with third parties.
No results found! Try another search
Enter a minimum of 3 characters to perform a search.
You may not have granted permission to access the photo gallery. Verify.
An error occurred with the keychain reading, please try again later.
Registration incomplete! Log in to Wikimedia Commons to continue.
The authorization on this monument has expired.
How do you want to reach %s?
Without active geolocation I am unable to plot a route!
As requested, you have been logged out by the application. Reopen this tab to start a new one and upload your photographs.
You have been logged out due to a problem. Reopen this tab to start a new one and upload your photographs.
Your data could not be deleted from the server. Make sure to revoke the oAuth authorization.\u0020
You are not logged in. Click on login to Wikimedia Commons to do so.
Something went wrong, retry later. If it happens again, please log out and log in again.
Before you can upload photographs, you must be logged into Wikimedia Commons.
Image %s not uploaded due to error.
Image %1$s not uploaded due to error: %2$s.
An error has occurred. Log out from the Upload Settings Manager in the settings tab.
Error uploading this image, please try again later.
Warning: the date format must be dd/mm/yyyyy such as 11/05/2005.
The fields are mandatory! Fill them all out before uploading.
Photos successfully queued for upload! You can check their status in the settings.
Something went wrong and the upload failed. Please try again later: %s.
Warning! You are using an outdated version of the app (%1$s). Go to the store and download the new version %2$s.

Wiki Loves Monuments is an international contest that aims to illustrate Wikipedia and Wikimedia projects through photographs of cultural heritage taken by citizens themselves, thus being also a great opportunity for tourism promotion.
It was born in 2010 and is organized annually around the world, in more than 50 countries, from 1 to 30 September.
In 2012 it entered the Guinness Book of Records as the largest photo contest in the world. Each year, more than 130,000 photographs are uploaded.
The subject of the images allowed to participate in the competition are monuments, a very broad set that includes buildings, sculptures, archaeological sites, architectural structures but also natural sites and landscape assets. All photographs are released under a free license and published on Wikimedia Commons, the large database that illustrates Wikipedia (the 5th most visited site in Italy) and all other projects with multimedia content (photos and videos).
Wiki Loves Monuments is open to the participation of everyone, professional photographers or amateurs, with no age limit. 
The Italian edition is organized since 2012 by Wikimedia Italia, an association that has been working since 2005 to spread knowledge and free culture in Italy, as a chapter of Wikimedia Foundation.
Insert the name of the city...
Insert the name of the monument...
Only photos uploaded from September 1 to 30 will participate in Wiki Loves Monuments.
From here you can control the settings related to your Wikimedia account with particular reference to the photo upload functionality from the app.
To continue, login or create an account on Wikimedia Commons by clicking the blue button above. If you have already logged in, click the button to verify that you are logged in.

You can leave the fields as they are or edit them making them more informative. Your choice!\nI agree to irrevocably release these images under the Creative Commons-Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 license. I understand that they will be published on Wikimedia Commons and will be reusable in perpetuity under the terms of that license. I also declare to be the author of the images. I am aware that the criminal and civil responsibility for what I upload is my own.
Welcome in the Wiki Loves Monuments Italy app! Do you know how to use it? If not, read our handy FAQs!
No, take me straight to the FAQs!
Yes, I\'m an expert. I don\'t need them.
Do you want to close WLM Italia?

You\'re going to login to Test Wiki. If you are not a tester, please do not login to the test wiki and instead do a single click (not a long press) on the button. Anyway, the photos that are uploaded on the test wiki do not participate in the contest.
